verses.text: Blessed is he whosetransgression isforgiven, whosesin iscovered.
Blessed isthe man unto whom the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*imputeth not iniquity, and in whose spirit there isno guile.
When I kept silence, my bones waxed old through my roaring all the day long.
For day and night thy hand was heavy upon me: my moisture is turned into the drought of summer. Selah.
I acknowledged my sin unto thee, and mine iniquity have I not hid. I said, I will confess my transgressions unto the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*; and thou forgavest the iniquity of my sin. Selah.
For this shall every one that is godly pray unto thee in a time when thou mayest be found: surely in the floods of great waters they shall not come nigh unto him.
Thou artmy hiding place; thou shalt preserve me from trouble; thou shalt compass me about with songs of deliverance. Selah.
I will instruct thee and teach thee in the way which thou shalt go: I will guide thee with mine eye.
Be ye not as the horse, oras the mule, whichhave no understanding: whose mouth must be held in with bit and bridle, lest they come near unto thee.
Many sorrows shall beto the wicked: but he that trusteth in the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*, mercy shall compass him about.
Be glad in the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*, and rejoice, ye righteous: and shout for joy, all ye that areupright in heart.
